title: The Great Gift Exchange – 105 . 7 The Point
body_text:

1. A poll asked, “If Santa Claus had a nationality, which country would he be from?” 34% said Norwegian. That was the top answer. 15% said Canadian . . . 6% said American (???) . . . another 6% said Russian . . . and 31% said “another country.” Like maybe Finnish, Turkish, Danish, and Greek.
2. It’s been a tough year for some companies, so people are venting about the “cheap and terrible ‘holiday bonuses’ they received.” They include: A sales team that got a book on how to be better at sales . . . a $10 Starbucks card . . . Cheesecake Factory workers were given a cheesecake, from Costco . . . a mandatory work party that COST money to attend . . . a $30 DoorDash voucher . . . and a subscription to a “Jelly of the Month” club. And one person said, “We got told we were getting nothing. Management’s excuse was ‘Well, not everyone celebrates Christmas, so it wouldn’t be fair.'”
3. Buzzfeed has a holiday-themed “Never Have I Ever” survey, and it found: 26% of people say they’ve never peeked at a present . . . 39% claim they’ve never re-gifted anything . . . 48% have never forgotten to buy gifts for someone . . . and 68% say they’ve never gone caroling.
4. According to AccuWeather, you may not want to get your hopes up for a “White Christmas.” The probability of snow is low for most of the country, with the exception of the Rocky Mountains . . . the northwest part of the Midwest . . . and northern New England, in upstate New York and Vermont.
A Thief Said “Happy Holidays” Then Pepper Sprayed People – LINK
Florida man gets ‘agitated’ by neighborhood Christmas parade, fires off several gunshots: deputies – LINK
The 10 ODDEST Guinness World Records of 2023 include: “Most skips by a cat in one minute” . . . “Loudest burp (female)” . . . and “Most people eating a single piece of spaghetti simultaneously”- LINK
Josh Homme is in a full bromance with Foo Fighters’ Dave Grohl, telling the ‘LA Times’, “Dave’s been the other love of my life.” Homme was especially candid about the recent ‘dark times’ he’s gone through, and how Dave was there through all of it: Those dark times include Homme’s a 2022 cancer diagnosis and headline-making divorce, as well as the passing of Grohl’s mother, Virginia, and bandmate, Taylor Hawkins – LINK
Marilyn Manson’s ex-assistant who filed suit against the rocker alleging sex discrimination, sexual harassment, sexual assault and sexual battery, has won her appeal in court – LINK
Sydney Sweeney got bitten on the arm by a massive Huntsman spider while filming her new movie “Anyone But You” in Australia. She brought the deleted scene from the actual bite to The Tonight Show – which we have on the blog — she was actually supposed to PRETEND it was biting her, but then it really dug in, so she started screaming for real.Her co-star Glen Powell seemed to be the first person to realize she wasn’t just acting.
Marvel Studios and Disney have announced Eyes of Wakanda – an animated series based on the Black Panther character – LINK

AND FINALLY!
A list of the 25 best Christmas movies from The Guardian came out.
Here’s their Top 10:
- “A Muppet Christmas Carol”, 1992
- “Tangerine”, 2015
- “The Apartment”, 1960
- “Gremlins”, 1984
- “Carol”, 2015
- “Meet Me in St. Louis”, 1944
- “The Long Kiss Goodnight”, 1996
- “It’s a Wonderful Life”, 1946
- “Elf”, 2003
- “The Dead”, 1987 – LINK
Our military would be way more badass if our soldiers had LIGHTSABERS, am I right? Well, those classic “Star Wars” weapons top a list of 11 pieces of movie tech that our military should actually develop.
- Lightsabers.
- Sticky gloves from “Mission: Impossible”. For scaling walls and stuff.
- Troop transporting time machine from “The Tomorrow War”. Allows you to recruit troops from the past to fight today’s battles.
- Magic healing cream from “The Hunger Games”. This one’s pretty self-explanatory.
- The Neuralyzer from “Men In Black”. That’s the little pen-type thing that emits a flash of light and makes people forget things.
- The Omega 13 from “Galaxy Quest”. It lets you go back in time 13 seconds . . . which in the movie is just enough time to redeem a single, deadly mistake.
- The Transporter from “Star Trek”. I think EVERYBODY wants this one. Except maybe the airlines . . . and people who’ve seen “The Fly”.
- DNA guns from “Judge Dredd”. A gun that only works when the DNA-coded user pulls the trigger? Try getting that one past the NRA.
- The Rehydrator from “Back to the Future Part 2”. It would be a much easier way for troops in the field to get a decent meal with this thing.
- Securefoam from “Demolition Man”. It’s like an airbag, but it fills up your car and envelopes you in a safety cocoon.
- The invisibility cloak from “Harry Potter”. This would obviously be cool, but it’s not tech, it’s MAGIC, so it really doesn’t belong on this list.
They probably should have gone with the suit from the 2020 version of “The Invisible Man” – LINK
NEW RELEASES IN RECORD STORES AND STREAMING:
The Black Crowes‘ second album, The Southern Harmony and Musical Companion, gets reissued as two-CD, three-CD and four-LP sets.
Long Story Short: Willie Nelson 90 Live at the Hollywood Bowl compiles highlights from the two massive tribute shows to the country legend from this year and includes performances by Keith Richards, Neil Young, Stephen Stills, Norah Jones, Beck, Bobby Weir, Chris Stapleton, Gary Clark Junior, Jack Johnson, Leon Bridges, Nathaniel Rateliff, Sheryl Crow, The Avett Brothers, The Lumineers, Tyler Childers, Warren Haynes and Ziggy Marley.

Stacy Thorn
Today’s birthday girl has been in 388 fine films, including:
– 2 Big 2 Be True 7
– American Ass 5
– Big Ass Orgy
– Daddy’s Little Bitch
– Daddy’s Worst Nightmare 2
– Down Wit Whitey
– Fast Times at Naughty America University 2
– Girth Wind and Fire 2
– Pile Drive Me
– Please Help Me Pay For College 39
– And who can forget her role in 2007’s For Once a Whore and Ever a Whore
Stacy Thorn is 40 years old
Less than a week after the Las Vegas Raiders scored no points at all versus the Vikings, they demolished the Los Angeles Chargers last night. Here’s Al Michaels summing it up at the end of the game.
The Blues began the interim coach’s tenure with a 4-2 win over the Senators on Thursday night to snap a four-game losing streak and climb their way back to a .500 record. Robert Thomas scored two goals as Brandon Saad and Pavel Buchenvich also scored. Thomas added a secondary assist on Buchnevich’s goal, the second time this season that he’s had at least three points. Jordan Binnington made 32 saves for his ninth win of the season. Blues beat Senators 4-2 to begin Drew Bannister’s tenure with a victory – LINK
City SC learned its first-round opponent for the CONCACAF Champions Cup yesterday. City SC will make its first venture into international soccer by playing not only a team also in Major League Soccer but one of only two other teams in the 27-team field from the Western Conference, the Houston Dynamo. The winner of that series will face the MLS Cup champion Columbus Crew. The earliest City SC would have to break out its passports would be the quarterfinals of the tournament, if it got that far. The first four rounds of the tournament will be two-game, home-and-home total-goal series played in February. City SC will face Houston Dynamo in first round of CONCACAF Champions Cup – LINK
Shohei Ohtani’s $700 million contract with the Los Angeles Dodgers — and its unprecedented deferrals — shocked the world, but probably not the San Francisco Giants. One day after the Dodgers officially announced the biggest deal in sports history by total value, Giants president of baseball operations Farhan Zaidi told reporters that Ohtani’s camp had presented the exact deal to San Francisco, and the Giants were agreeable to it. Ohtani instead opted for the Dodgers. Shohei Ohtani free agency: Giants president says team was presented same deal as Dodgers – LINK
The National Football League is continuing to bring the sport to other parts of the world. On Wednesday, the league announced a game to be played in Sao Paulo, Brazil, in 2024. The new location will join London, England, and Munich, Germany, as hosts to a total of five international games next season. League owners also approved a total of eight international games beginning in 2025.
